intro: Rapuntium haenkeanum, commonly known as the Himalayan buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic flowering plants. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in the spring. It has a short life cycle and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Its leaves are palmately divided and covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss in its harsh habitat.
